intro: Tradescantia crassula, commonly known as the Inch Plant or Mother of Thousands, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. Tradescantia crassula is also known for its ability to propagate easily through leaf cuttings, which contributes to its popularity as a houseplant.
